title.description: the default title of window created by node-webkit, it's very useful if you want to show your own title when the app is starting.

width.description: the initial width of the main window.

height.description: the initial height of the main window.

toolbar.description: should the navigation toolbar be showed.

position.description: be null or center or mouse, controls where window will be put

as_desktop.description: show as desktop background window under X11 environment

always-on-top.description: whether the window should always stay on top of other windows.

visible-on-all-workspaces.description: whether the window should be visible on all workspaces simultaneously (on platforms that support multiple workspaces, currently Mac OS X and Linux).

show_in_taskbar.description: whether the window is shown in taskbar or dock. The default is true.

frame.description: specify it to false to make the window frameless

show.description: specify it to false if you want your app to be hidden on startup

kiosk.description: whether to use Kiosk mode. In Kiosk mode, the app will be fullscreen and try to prevent users from leaving the app, so you should remember to provide a way in app to leave Kiosk mode. This mode is mainly used for presentation on public displays

transparent.description: whether to turn on transparent window mode. The default is false.
